[![Maxwells thermic engine.png](/images/f/fb/Maxwells_thermic_engine.png)](/File:Maxwells_thermic_engine.png) **the +2 Maxwell's thermic engine**

+2 [double sword](/Double_sword "Double sword")

Simultaneous [Flaming](/Flaming "Flaming") and [Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing") brands (applies both)  
Enchantment increases as you land hits and decreases over time

## Mechanics

The engine's enchantment increases by 1 or 2 each time its wielder lands a hit (including those from ripostes from the [fencer's gloves](/Fencer%27s_gloves "Fencer's gloves")), up to a maximum of +14. It decreases by 1 for each turn spent not hitting a creature (i.e. not attacking, moving, waiting, missed swings, etc.), but will not decrease past the base level of +2. The enchantment immediately drops to +2 if the sword is unwielded.

This weapon will cauterize a [hydra](/Hydra "Hydra")'s heads like any other edged weapon of flaming, then apply freezing for the chance to slow (without cutting another head).

## Desirability

High. Double swords are one of the best one-handed [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades"), and flaming and freezing are great brands on their own. So, as a double sword with both brands, and the potential for high enchant, **Maxwell's thermic engine**[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) is among the strongest one-handers before [extended](/Extended "Extended"). (As extended is filled with evil, a [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") weapon will usually come out ahead.)

Do note that, in order to increase the enchantment, you actually need to hit. If you're facing high-[EV](/EV "EV") creatures, it can take a while to get this sword going; a more conventionally enchanted sword may perform better in this circumstance.

## History

- Prior to [0.22](/0.22 "0.22"), Maxwell's thermic engine gave its wielder rF- and rC-.
- Maxwell's thermic engine was added in [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), replacing both the [Dagger of Chilly Death](/Dagger_of_Chilly_Death "Dagger of Chilly Death") and [Scimitar of Flaming Death](/Scimitar_of_Flaming_Death "Scimitar of Flaming Death").

## References
